Sentencas: This work investigates the sintering characteristics and electrical properties of SDC electrolytes prepared with glycine-nitrate-combustion derived powders, which are often used for fabricating dense SDC electrolyte films using a dry-pressing process.
Titulo: Sintering of Samarium-doped ceria powders prepared by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: The compact powders show the highest sintering rate at 730 degrees C and are sintered to 90.7% of theoretical density at 1300 degrees C for 5 h. However, using the powder as the precursor, SDC films can be sintered to be much denser (about 99% of the theoretical density) even at 1250 degrees C when the electrolyte layers are co-sintered with NiO-SDC substrates.
Titulo: Sintering of Samarium-doped ceria powders prepared by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: In addition to increased density, increasing the sintering temperature causes enlargement of crystalline parameters, which is possibly due to the reduction of Ce4+ to Ce3+.
Titulo: Sintering of Samarium-doped ceria powders prepared by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: The reduction is associated with the formation of oxygen vacancies, which might cause defect-association and thus promote the activation energy for oxygen-ion conduction.
Titulo: Sintering of Samarium-doped ceria powders prepared by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: It is found that the conductivity increases with the sintering temperature to its maximum when SDC is sintered at 1300 degrees C. (C) 2010
Titulo: Sintering of Samarium-doped ceria powders prepared by a glycine-nitrate process
Sintering of Samarium-doped ceria powders prepared by a glycine-nitrate process
